alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; East Feliciana; Iberville; Livingston; Pointe Coupee; St. Helena (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 16 at 4:06PM CST until further notice by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Louisiana and southern Mississippi, including the following county and parishes, in southeast Louisiana, East Baton Rouge, East Feliciana, Iberville, Livingston, Pointe Coupee, St. Helena, West Baton Rouge and West Feliciana. In southern Mississippi, Amite. * WHEN...Until 700 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 406 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen from earlier heavy rain, and additional rainfall could cause minor flooding to redevelop in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches, with locally greater amounts are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Baton Rouge, Zachary, Baker, Denham Springs, Port Allen, Jackson, Clinton, Greensburg, Addis, Brusly, Maringouin, Slaughter, Rosedale, Grosse Tete, Wilson, Norwood, Brownfields, Greenwell Spring, Merrydale and Pride. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge; East Feliciana; Iberville; Livingston; Pointe Coupee; St. Helena
